hero_section.title: Heartfelt, hometown care brought to life

make_families_whole_section.title: Making Families Whole Again
make_families_whole_section.paragraph: Trying to balance being a family member with being a caregiver can be stressful and exhausting. We’d like to help relieve some of that strain so all you have to focus on is being a family.

icon_box_one.title: Memory Care
icon_box_one.paragraph: We offer both in-home and community care purposefully and specially designed to aid those with cognitive challenges caused by memory impairment, dementia, and Alzheimer’s.

icon_box_two.title: Respite Care
icon_box_two.paragraph: Caregiving is often an around-the-clock commitment. Whether it’s a few hours or a few weeks, respite care can give you the peace of mind that your loved one is still being well taken care of, even when you can’t.

who_abide_is_for_section.title: Who Abide is For
who_abide_is_for_section.paragraph: For many seniors, home will always be where the heart is, and their greatest desire is to live independently for as long as possible. That’s why Abide Home Care offers non-medical, in-home care 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.

the_benefits_section.title: The benefits
the_benefits_section.paragraph: Many seniors prefer to maintain their independence in their homes with support from a trusted companion. With that desire in mind, we offer non-medical caregivers and companions for senior care at home, residents in long-term care settings, and those in the hospital recovering from an illness.

services_timeline.title: How We Abide With You
services_timeline.paragraph: At Abide Home Care, our quality In-Home Care helps provide you or a loved one with an enhanced lifestyle & ongoing independence with reliable care. We are committed to seeing those we serve become family again.
services_timeline.after_timeline_title: As Your Needs Change, We Will Be With You Every Step Of The Way
services_timeline.after_timeline_paragraph: We support clients' and their families’ unique needs with our personalized home care solutions. Our goal is simple - to see those we serve become family again.

hero_section.title: Our Story
hero_section.paragraph: What began as a small, private in-home care business, driven by a team with a heart for caring, has grown into a state-wide, award-winning company. The secret to our success is simple: We remain dedicated to keeping families together and promoting independence, all by upholding an unwavering dedication to excellence in our mission to remain people-focused and client obsessed.

why_we_care_section.title: Why we care
why_we_care_section.paragraph:
Through meaningful conversations, we develop care plans unique to our clients' needs and discover what brings them joy. We are then able to help improve the quality of life for our clients and their families. Through these efforts, we are able to make a true and impactful difference. By providing care and emotional support, we are able to restore peace of mind and dignity in a time when families feel most vulnerable. 

As a company, we pour our collective hearts and souls into what we do; the services we provide, and the lives we are able to change for the better. We believe that serving our clients, treasuring our employees, and operating with the utmost dedication to service is what sets us apart and inevitably makes us the ideal choice for a home care provider.

team_section.title: Meet Our Team
team_section.paragraph: Headquartered in Statesboro, Georgia, the Abide Home Care corporate team is a combination of diverse backgrounds and experiences who all share two important traits - a passion for caring for others and an unwavering commitment to deliver quality experiences and interactions in unexpected ways.

icon_section.title: Employment Inquiries
icon_section.paragraph: Looking for a new career opportunity? We are driven by a single mission - to be passionate about people and client obsessed.

icon_section.title: Care Inquiries
icon_section.paragraph: Our regional office teams are ready and willing to serve you. Contact us today to schedule an in-home consultation.

icon_section.title: All Other Inquiries
icon_section.paragraph: Have another question? No problem. We are happy to help. Contact us and we will respond promptly.

prefer_to_talk_section.title: Prefer to talk?
prefer_to_talk_section.paragraph: Our regional home care offices are nestled around the state. Simply find the location closest to you and give us a call.

hero_section.title: How We Help You live well
hero_section.paragraph: Home will always be where the heart is, and that's where we come in. Offering award-winning, best-in-class, private home care, we can help you remain in your home for as long as you wish.

service.title: Daily Errands
service.paragraph: From a trip to the beauty salon to a supermarket produce run, we are happy to drive you around town. (And tote your bags!) Maybe you'd just like to rest and let us take care of the errands? We can do both! Some of the frequent errands we currently provide for clients include:

service.title: Companionship
service.paragraph: One of the best services that we provide is simply helping to brighten our clients' days by spending quality time with them, doing activities they enjoy. This can include:

service.title: Light Housekeeping
service.paragraph: Don’t worry, we will take care of the dishes and dusting. Need a load of clothes washed? No problem. We are happy to do that for you. Life just became a lot sweeter with Abide Home Care. Prop your feet up, we are also able to provide:

service.title: Hygiene
service.paragraph: Hygiene maintenance is so important, not only to be able to enjoy life, but also in order to maintain comfort and health. Our caregivers are able to assist in any of the following ways:

service.title: Short Term Care
service.paragraph: Allowing families to remain families, respite care benefits both the person receiving care and their primary caregivers. We are here to help fill any gaps for your family and work with your individual schedule and needs. A few of the benefits of respite care include:

subservices.title: Allowing Family Members to Tend to Other Obligations
Respite care is an ideal option for expectant mothers on bed rest, who can no longer provide full time care.

service.title: Dementia Support
service.paragraph: Caring for a person that has Alzheimer’s or dementia usually takes a team of people. We are ready to become a member of your personal care team. Our caregivers are highly-trained, skilled professionals, and therefore are able to identify and best handle the symptoms of dementia. In addition, our care team will focus on the following:

subservices.title: Regular Assessment of the Care Plan

trusted_caregiver_section.pretitle: 24 hours a day, 365 days a year
trusted_caregiver_section.title: Trusted Caregivers
trusted_caregiver_section.paragraph: You can trust our caregivers with the safety and well-being of your loved one because every Abide Home Care caregiver is thoroughly screened, trained, insured, and supervised by a Registered Nurse.

qualifications.title: Certified Nurse Aide or Personal Care Assistant

hero_section.title: Where do we abide?
hero_section.paragraph: Proudly serving over 70 counties throughout the state of Georgia, one of our regional offices is only one call away. Enter your zip code below to contact the office closest to you.

hero_section.title: Careers That Inspire
hero_section.paragraph: Serving our clients, treasuring our employees, and operating with the utmost dedication to service is our mission. Come see what makes us a truly exceptional place to work.

culture_and_values_section.title: Our Mission
culture_and_values_section.paragraph:
The Mission of Abide Home Care is to provide warm, personalized care that focuses on the individual’s well-being and safety, enhances their independence, and promotes dignity and quality of life. We seek to make a positive impact every day for seniors in our community.

Abide Home Care envisions a world in which senior citizens can age gracefully, socialize often, and live confidently. We choose to make a positive difference in the aging experience. The Abide Home Care team will perform its collective duties with confidence, concern, commitment, cheerfulness, and care. We will treat every contact as a friend, every client as family, and perform every task as an honor.

benefits.title: Personal Growth
benefits.paragraph: Working with seniors can provide many opportunities for personal growth. Not only can it help drive you to be more compassionate, but it may also help you find a new sense of purpose. Caregivers gain self-esteem and personal satisfaction from knowing that the comfort and care they provide enriches the lives of the people around them.

benefits.title: Professional Development
benefits.paragraph: If you are looking for a career opportunity where you are able to continue to advance, look no further than Abide Home Care. Whether you begin your Abide journey in one of our regional offices or in the field as a caregiver, you will acquire many skills that can easily help to build your resume. From fine-tuning your communication skills to learning new coping mechanisms and strategies for life, the rewards keep on giving.

benefits.title: Health & Wellness
benefits.paragraph: Working as a caregiver has many surprising benefits for your health and wellness. You are able to remain physically active while serving others. In addition, you are able to develop a new level of empathy for others. Also, by working daily to help others, you are then better able to tune out the “noise” of life, positively impacting your mental health.

benefits.title: Flexibility
benefits.paragraph: Caregiving allows you to create your own work schedule. Maybe you only want to work on the weekend or during evening hours? Have a schedule that promotes a better work-life balance. With the ever-changing needs of clients and different families, in-home care options allow you to be able to find a schedule that fits your needs.

beliefs_section.title: Our Beliefs & Values
beliefs_section.paragraph: We are deeply committed to keeping our word, engaging everyone, and being trusted by all. When we promise something, we deliver. When we say we care, we do. Caring for the specific needs of our clients while also caring for the needs and desires of the family is our sole focus. When it comes to serving our clients, their families, our communities, and our healthcare partners, we seek to be dependable and reliable, so they can feel secure in our care.

hero_section.title: Care Solutions for Providers
hero_section.paragraph: Abide Home Care provides ease of access to care solutions for physicians, discharge planners, and case managers. Assisted Living Facility? No problem. We can help fill any gap for any patient or resident.

content_sections.title: Healthcare Providers
content_sections.paragraph: Abide Home Care caregivers are able to assist with bathing, feeding, and transportation to and from physicians appointments. Our support leads to improved compliance with follow-up appointments post-operatively and post-hospital discharge. Abide Home Care caregivers are also professionally trained in offering support and assistance with Dementia care. Abide Home Care offers non-medical, in-home care - 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.

content_sections.title: Discharge Planner / Case Manager
content_sections.paragraph: Discharging a patient with home health services? Give us a call to fill in the gap. We are able to help with post-hospital discharge assistance and care. We provide transportation to follow-up physicians appointments and physical therapy appointments, and provide assistance with ADLs. We also help with bathing and feeding. Our caregivers are specially trained to provide support with Dementia Care. No referral is needed, simply fill out the care inquiry form here, and please be sure to include family or patient contact information.

content_sections.title: Staffing Services
content_sections.paragraph: Need to fill a last-minute gap in staffing? Abide Home Care is happy to help. We can easily provide qualified caregivers to help ease the burden on your Personal Care Home or Assisted Living Facility. Every Abide caregiver is thoroughly screened, trained, insured, and RN supervised. We also make sure every caregiver has the needed professional qualifications.

services_section.title: Services
services_section.paragraph: We know every person is unique - just as their care plan should be. Here are some of the ways we can assist our clients:

trusted_caregiver_section.pretitle: 24 hours a day, 365 days a year
trusted_caregiver_section.title: Trusted Caregivers
trusted_caregiver_section.paragraph: Every Abide caregiver is thoroughly screened, trained, insured, and RN supervised. The professional qualifications of our caregivers include:

qualifications.title: CNA or PCA or Equivalent Experience

acf.content:
PRIVACY POLICY:

Georgia Living Senior Care (“Georgia Living Senior Care”) operates georgialivingseniorcare.com and may operate other websites. It is Georgia Living Senior Care’s policy to respect your privacy regarding any information we may collect while operating our websites.

WEBSITE VISITORS

Like most website operators, Georgia Living Senior Care collects non-personally identifying information of the sort that web browsers and servers typically make available, such as the browser type, language preference, referring site, and the date and time of each visitor request. Georgia Living Senior Care’s purpose in collecting non-personally identifying information is to better understand how Georgia Living Senior Care’s visitors use its website. From time to time, Georgia Living Senior Care may release non-personally identifying information in the aggregate, e.g., by publishing a report on trends in the usage of its website.

Georgia Living Senior Care also collects potentially personally-identifying information like Internet Protocol (IP) addresses for logged-in users and for users leaving comments on georgialivingseniorcare.com blogs/sites. Georgia Living Senior Care only discloses logged-in user and commenter IP addresses under the same circumstances that it uses and discloses personally-identifying information as described below, except that commenter IP addresses and email addresses are visible and disclosed to the administrators of the blog/site where the comment was left.

GATHERING OF PERSONALLY-IDENTIFYING INFORMATION

Certain visitors to Georgia Living Senior Care’s websites choose to interact with Georgia Living Senior Care in ways that require Georgia Living Senior Care to gather personally identifying information. The amount and type of information that Georgia Living Senior Care gathers depends on the nature of the interaction. For example, we ask visitors who sign up at georgialivingseniorcare.com to provide a username and email address. Those who engage in transactions with Georgia Living Senior Care are asked to provide additional information, including as necessary the personal and financial information required to process those transactions. In each case, Georgia Living Senior Care collects such information only insofar as is necessary or appropriate to fulfill the purpose of the visitor’s interaction with Georgia Living Senior Care. Georgia Living Senior Care does not disclose personally-identifying information other than as described below. And visitors can always refuse to supply personally-identifying information, with the caveat that it may prevent them from engaging in certain website-related activities.

AGGREGATED STATISTICS

Georgia Living Senior Care may collect statistics about the behavior of visitors to its websites. Georgia Living Senior Care may display this information publicly or provide it to others. However, Georgia Living Senior Care does not disclose personally-identifying information other than as described below.

PROTECTION OF CERTAIN PERSONALLY-IDENTIFYING INFORMATION

Georgia Living Senior Care discloses potentially personally-identifying and personally-identifying information only to those of its employees, contractors, and affiliated organizations that (i) need to know that information in order to process it on Georgia Living Senior Care’s behalf or to provide services available at Georgia Living Senior Care’s websites, and (ii) that have agreed not to disclose it to others. Some of those employees, contractors, and affiliated organizations may be located outside of your home country; by using Georgia Living Senior Care’s websites, you consent to the transfer of such information to them. Georgia Living Senior Care will not rent or sell potentially personally-identifying and personally-identifying information to anyone. Other than to its employees, contractors, and affiliated organizations, as described above, Georgia Living Senior Care discloses potentially personally-identifying and personally-identifying information only in response to a subpoena, court order, or other governmental requests, or when Georgia Living Senior Care believes in good faith that disclosure is reasonably necessary to protect the property or rights of Georgia Living Senior Care, third parties or the public at large. If you are a registered user of the Georgia Living Senior Care website and have supplied your email address, Georgia Living Senior Care may occasionally send you an email to tell you about new features, solicit your feedback, or just keep you up to date with what’s going on with Georgia Living Senior Care and our products. If you send us a request (for example via email or via one of our feedback mechanisms), we reserve the right to publish it in order to help us clarify or respond to your request or to help us support other users. Georgia Living Senior Care takes all measures reasonably necessary to protect against the unauthorized access, use, alteration or destruction of potentially personally-identifying and personally-identifying information.

COOKIES

A cookie is a string of information that a website stores on a visitor’s computer, and that the visitor’s browser provides to the website each time the visitor returns. Georgia Living Senior Care uses cookies to help Georgia Living Senior Care identify and track visitors, their usage of the Georgia Living Senior Care website, and their website access preferences. Georgia Living Senior Care visitors who do not wish to have cookies placed on their computers should set their browsers to refuse cookies before using Georgia Living Senior Care’s websites, with the drawback that certain features of Georgia Living Senior Care’s websites may not function properly without the aid of cookies.

BUSINESS TRANSFERS

If Georgia Living Senior Care, or substantially all of its assets, were acquired, or in the unlikely event that Georgia Living Senior Care goes out of business or enters bankruptcy, user information would be one of the assets that are transferred or acquired by a third party. You acknowledge that such transfers may occur and that any acquirer of Georgia Living Senior Care may continue to use your personal information as set forth in this policy.

ADS

Ads appearing on any of our websites may be delivered to users by advertising partners, who may set cookies. These cookies allow the ad server to recognize your computer each time they send you an online advertisement to compile information about you or others who use your computer. This information allows ad networks to, among other things, deliver targeted advertisements that they believe will be of most interest to you. This Privacy Policy covers the use of cookies by Georgia Living Senior Care and does not cover the use of cookies by any advertisers.

PRIVACY POLICY CHANGES

Although most changes are likely to be minor, Georgia Living Senior Care may change its Privacy Policy from time to time, and in Georgia Living Senior Care’s sole discretion. Georgia Living Senior Care encourages visitors to frequently check this page for any changes to its Privacy Policy. If you have a georgialivingseniorcare.com account, you might also receive an alert informing you of these changes. Your continued use of this site after any change in this Privacy Policy will constitute your acceptance of such change.

acf.content:
TERMS OF SERVICE:

The following terms and conditions govern all use of the georgialivingseniorcare.com website and all content, services and products available at or through the website (taken together, the Website). The Website is owned and operated by Georgia Living Senior Care (“Georgia Living Senior Care”). The Website is offered subject to your acceptance without modification of all of the terms and conditions contained herein and all other operating rules, policies (including, without limitation, Georgia Living Senior Care’s Privacy Policy) and procedures that may be published from time to time on this Site by Georgia Living Senior Care (collectively, the “Agreement”).

Please read this Agreement carefully before accessing or using the Website. By accessing or using any part of the web site, you agree to become bound by the terms and conditions of this agreement. If you do not agree to all the terms and conditions of this agreement, then you may not access the Website or use any services. If these terms and conditions are considered an offer by Georgia Living Senior Care, acceptance is expressly limited to these terms. The Website is available only to individuals who are at least 13 years old.

1. Your georgialivingseniorcare.com Account and Site. If you create a blog/site on the Website, you are responsible for maintaining the security of your account and blog, and you are fully responsible for all activities that occur under the account and any other actions taken in connection with the blog. You must not describe or assign keywords to your blog in a misleading or unlawful manner, including in a manner intended to trade on the name or reputation of others, and Georgia Living Senior Care may change or remove any description or keyword that it considers inappropriate or unlawful, or otherwise likely to cause Georgia Living Senior Care liability. You must immediately notify Georgia Living Senior Care of any unauthorized uses of your blog, your account or any other breaches of security. Georgia Living Senior Care will not be liable for any acts or omissions by You, including any damages of any kind incurred as a result of such acts or omissions.

2. Responsibility of Contributors. If you operate a blog, comment on a blog, post material to the Website, post links on the Website, or otherwise make (or allow any third party to make) material available by means of the Website (any such material, “Content”), You are entirely responsible for the content of, and any harm resulting from, that Content. That is the case regardless of whether the Content in question constitutes text, graphics, an audio file, or computer software. By making Content available, you represent and warrant that:

    • the downloading, copying and use of the Content will not infringe the proprietary rights, including but not limited to the copyright, patent, trademark or trade secret rights, of any third party;
    • if your employer has rights to intellectual property you create, you have either (i) received permission from your employer to post or make available the Content, including but not limited to any software, or (ii) secured from your employer a waiver as to all rights in or to the Content;
    • you have fully complied with any third-party licenses relating to the Content, and have done all things necessary to successfully pass through to end users any required terms;
      the Content does not contain or install any viruses, worms, malware, Trojan horses or other harmful or destructive content;
    • the Content is not spam, is not machine- or randomly-generated, and does not contain unethical or unwanted commercial content designed to drive traffic to third party sites or boost the search engine rankings of third party sites, or to further unlawful acts (such as phishing) or mislead recipients as to the source of the material (such as spoofing);
    • the Content is not pornographic, does not contain threats or incite violence towards individuals or entities, and does not violate the privacy or publicity rights of any third party;
      your blog is not getting advertised via unwanted electronic messages such as spam links on newsgroups, email lists, other blogs and web sites, and similar unsolicited promotional methods;
    • your blog is not named in a manner that misleads your readers into thinking that you are another person or company. For example, your blog’s URL or name is not the name of a person other than yourself or company other than your own; and
    • you have, in the case of Content that includes computer code, accurately categorized and/or described the type, nature, uses and effects of the materials, whether requested to do so by Georgia Living Senior Care or otherwise.

By submitting Content to Georgia Living Senior Care for inclusion on your Website, you grant Georgia Living Senior Care a world-wide, royalty-free, and non-exclusive license to reproduce, modify, adapt and publish the Content solely for the purpose of displaying, distributing and promoting your blog. If you delete Content, Georgia Living Senior Care will use reasonable efforts to remove it from the Website, but you acknowledge that caching or references to the Content may not be made immediately unavailable.

Without limiting any of those representations or warranties, Georgia Living Senior Care has the right (though not the obligation) to, in Georgia Living Senior Care’s sole discretion (i) refuse or remove any content that, in Georgia Living Senior Care’s reasonable opinion, violates any Georgia Living Senior Care policy or is in any way harmful or objectionable, or (ii) terminate or deny access to and use of the Website to any individual or entity for any reason, in Georgia Living Senior Care’s sole discretion. Georgia Living Senior Care will have no obligation to provide a refund of any amounts previously paid.

3. Payment and Renewal.

  • General Terms.
    By selecting a product or service, you agree to pay Georgia Living Senior Care the one-time and/or monthly or annual subscription fees indicated (additional payment terms may be included in other communications). Subscription payments will be charged on a pre-pay basis on the day you sign up for an Upgrade and will cover the use of that service for a monthly or annual subscription period as indicated. Payments are not refundable.
  • Automatic Renewal.
    Unless you notify Georgia Living Senior Care before the end of the applicable subscription period that you want to cancel a subscription, your subscription will automatically renew and you authorize us to collect the then-applicable annual or monthly subscription fee for such subscription (as well as any taxes) using any credit card or other payment mechanism we have on record for you. Upgrades can be canceled at any time by submitting your request to Georgia Living Senior Care in writing.

4. Services.

  • Fees; Payment. By signing up for a Services account you agree to pay Georgia Living Senior Care the applicable setup fees and recurring fees. Applicable fees will be invoiced starting from the day your services are established and in advance of using such services. Georgia Living Senior Care reserves the right to change the payment terms and fees upon thirty (30) days prior written notice to you. Services can be canceled by you at anytime on thirty (30) days written notice to Georgia Living Senior Care.
  • Support. If your service includes access to priority email support. “Email support” means the ability to make requests for technical support assistance by email at any time (with reasonable efforts by Georgia Living Senior Care to respond within one business day) concerning the use of the VIP Services. “Priority” means that support takes priority over support for users of the standard or free georgialivingseniorcare.com services. All support will be provided in accordance with Georgia Living Senior Care standard services practices, procedures and policies.

5. Responsibility of Website Visitors. Georgia Living Senior Care has not reviewed, and cannot review, all of the material, including computer software, posted to the Website, and cannot therefore be responsible for that material’s content, use or effects. By operating the Website, Georgia Living Senior Care does not represent or imply that it endorses the material there posted, or that it believes such material to be accurate, useful or non-harmful. You are responsible for taking precautions as necessary to protect yourself and your computer systems from viruses, worms, Trojan horses, and other harmful or destructive content. The Website may contain content that is offensive, indecent, or otherwise objectionable, as well as content containing technical inaccuracies, typographical mistakes, and other errors. The Website may also contain material that violates the privacy or publicity rights, or infringes the intellectual property and other proprietary rights, of third parties, or the downloading, copying or use of which is subject to additional terms and conditions, stated or unstated. Georgia Living Senior Care disclaims any responsibility for any harm resulting from the use by visitors of the Website, or from any downloading by those visitors of content there posted.

6. Content Posted on Other Websites. We have not reviewed, and cannot review, all of the material, including computer software, made available through the websites and webpages to which georgialivingseniorcare.com links, and that link to georgialivingseniorcare.com. Georgia Living Senior Care does not have any control over those non-Georgia Living Senior Care websites and webpages, and is not responsible for their contents or their use. By linking to a non-Georgia Living Senior Care website or webpage, Georgia Living Senior Care does not represent or imply that it endorses such website or webpage. You are responsible for taking precautions as necessary to protect yourself and your computer systems from viruses, worms, Trojan horses, and other harmful or destructive content. Georgia Living Senior Care disclaims any responsibility for any harm resulting from your use of non-Georgia Living Senior Care websites and webpages.

7. Copyright Infringement and DMCA Policy. As Georgia Living Senior Care asks others to respect its intellectual property rights, it respects the intellectual property rights of others. If you believe that material located on or linked to by georgialivingseniorcare.com violates your copyright, you are encouraged to notify Georgia Living Senior Care in accordance with Georgia Living Senior Care’s Digital Millennium Copyright Act (“DMCA”) Policy. Georgia Living Senior Care will respond to all such notices, including as required or appropriate by removing the infringing material or disabling all links to the infringing material. Georgia Living Senior Care will terminate a visitor’s access to and use of the Website if, under appropriate circumstances, the visitor is determined to be a repeat infringer of the copyrights or other intellectual property rights of Georgia Living Senior Care or others. In the case of such termination, Georgia Living Senior Care will have no obligation to provide a refund of any amounts previously paid to Georgia Living Senior Care.

8. Intellectual Property. This Agreement does not transfer from Georgia Living Senior Care to you any Georgia Living Senior Care or third party intellectual property, and all right, title and interest in and to such property will remain (as between the parties) solely with Georgia Living Senior Care. Georgia Living Senior Care, georgialivingseniorcare.com, the georgialivingseniorcare.com logo, and all other trademarks, service marks, graphics and logos used in connection with georgialivingseniorcare.com, or the Website are trademarks or registered trademarks of Georgia Living Senior Care or Georgia Living Senior Care’s licensors. Other trademarks, service marks, graphics and logos used in connection with the Website may be the trademarks of other third parties. Your use of the Website grants you no right or license to reproduce or otherwise use any Georgia Living Senior Care or third-party trademarks.

9. Advertisements. Georgia Living Senior Care reserves the right to display advertisements on your blog unless you have purchased an ad-free account.

10. Attribution. Georgia Living Senior Care reserves the right to display attribution links such as ‘Blog at georgialivingseniorcare.com,’ theme author, and font attribution in your blog footer or toolbar.

11. Partner Products. By activating a partner product (e.g. theme) from one of our partners, you agree to that partner’s terms of service. You can opt out of their terms of service at any time by de-activating the partner product.

12. Domain Names. If you are registering a domain name, using or transferring a previously registered domain name, you acknowledge and agree that use of the domain name is also subject to the policies of the Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers (“ICANN”), including their Registration Rights and Responsibilities.

13. Changes. Georgia Living Senior Care reserves the right, at its sole discretion, to modify or replace any part of this Agreement. It is your responsibility to check this Agreement periodically for changes. Your continued use of or access to the Website following the posting of any changes to this Agreement constitutes acceptance of those changes. Georgia Living Senior Care may also, in the future, offer new services and/or features through the Website (including, the release of new tools and resources). Such new features and/or services shall be subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement.

14. Termination. Georgia Living Senior Care may terminate your access to all or any part of the Website at any time, with or without cause, with or without notice, effective immediately. If you wish to terminate this Agreement or your georgialivingseniorcare.com account (if you have one), you may simply discontinue using the Website. Notwithstanding the foregoing, if you have a paid services account, such account can only be terminated by Georgia Living Senior Care if you materially breach this Agreement and fail to cure such breach within thirty (30) days from Georgia Living Senior Care’s notice to you thereof; provided that, Georgia Living Senior Care can terminate the Website immediately as part of a general shut down of our service. All provisions of this Agreement which by their nature should survive termination shall survive termination, including, without limitation, ownership provisions, warranty disclaimers, indemnity and limitations of liability.

15. Disclaimer of Warranties. The Website is provided “as is”. Georgia Living Senior Care and its suppliers and licensors hereby disclaim all warranties of any kind, express or implied, including, without limitation, the warranties of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose and non-infringement. Neither Georgia Living Senior Care nor its suppliers and licensors, makes any warranty that the Website will be error free or that access thereto will be continuous or uninterrupted. You understand that you download from, or otherwise obtain content or services through, the Website at your own discretion and risk.

16. Limitation of Liability. In no event will Georgia Living Senior Care, or its suppliers or licensors, be liable with respect to any subject matter of this agreement under any contract, negligence, strict liability or other legal or equitable theory for: (i) any special, incidental or consequential damages; (ii) the cost of procurement for substitute products or services; (iii) for interruption of use or loss or corruption of data; or (iv) for any amounts that exceed the fees paid by you to Georgia Living Senior Care under this agreement during the twelve (12) month period prior to the cause of action. Georgia Living Senior Care shall have no liability for any failure or delay due to matters beyond their reasonable control. The foregoing shall not apply to the extent prohibited by applicable law.

17. General Representation and Warranty. You represent and warrant that (i) your use of the Website will be in strict accordance with the Georgia Living Senior Care Privacy Policy, with this Agreement and with all applicable laws and regulations (including without limitation any local laws or regulations in your country, state, city, or other governmental area, regarding online conduct and acceptable content, and including all applicable laws regarding the transmission of technical data exported from the United States or the country in which you reside) and (ii) your use of the Website will not infringe or misappropriate the intellectual property rights of any third party.

18. Indemnification. You agree to indemnify and hold harmless Georgia Living Senior Care, its contractors, and its licensors, and their respective directors, officers, employees and agents from and against any and all claims and expenses, including attorneys’ fees, arising out of your use of the Website, including but not limited to your violation of this Agreement.

19. Miscellaneous. This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between Georgia Living Senior Care and you concerning the subject matter hereof, and they may only be modified by a written amendment signed by an authorized executive of Georgia Living Senior Care, or by the posting by Georgia Living Senior Care of a revised version. Except to the extent applicable law, if any, provides otherwise, this Agreement, any access to or use of the Website will be governed by the laws of the state of Georgia, excluding its conflict of law provisions, and the proper venue for any disputes arising out of or relating to any of the same will be the state and federal courts located in Savannah, GA. Except for claims for injunctive or equitable relief or claims regarding intellectual property rights (which may be brought in any competent court without the posting of a bond), any dispute arising under this Agreement shall be finally settled in accordance with the Comprehensive Arbitration Rules of the Judicial Arbitration and Mediation Service, Inc. (“JAMS”) by three arbitrators appointed in accordance with such Rules. The arbitration shall take place in Savannah, GA, in the English language and the arbitral decision may be enforced in any court. The prevailing party in any action or proceeding to enforce this Agreement shall be entitled to costs and attorneys’ fees. If any part of this Agreement is held invalid or unenforceable, that part will be construed to reflect the parties’ original intent, and the remaining portions will remain in full force and effect. A waiver by either party of any term or condition of this Agreement or any breach thereof, in any one instance, will not waive such term or condition or any subsequent breach thereof. You may assign your rights under this Agreement to any party that consents to, and agrees to be bound by, its terms and conditions; Georgia Living Senior Care may assign its rights under this Agreement without condition. This Agreement will be binding upon and will inure to the benefit of the parties, their successors and permitted assigns.
